name: Age of Chivalry
description: Prepare to be captivated by a spectacle of medieval marvels: witness knights clashing in thrilling jousting tournaments, artisan craft vendors and their exquisite treasures, and delectable food fit for a king.

name: Alabama Medieval Fantasy Festival
description: The moment you step through the gates of the Alabama Medieval Fantasy Festival and into the Mythical Kingdom of Dragon Croft, the technological, digital addicted, 21st Century life as you know it starts to vanish into the cool wooded landscape and your transition to the year 815, begins.

name: Arizona Renaissance Festival
description: Time travel to the greatest party since Camelot! Take a stroll through the colorful Village of Fairhaven where history comes alive with non-stop, day-long, immersive and interactive entertainments like no place else!  Shop an abundance of arts and crafts in the village open-air Artisan Market!

name: Arkansas Renaissance Festival
description: Arkansas’ first permanent Renaissance Festival, this immersive event brings to life the sights, sounds, and spirit of a 16th-century European village. We have worked hard to bring together live jousting, enchanting performances, artisan vendors, and medieval feasts so there’s something for everyone to enjoy.

name: Avalon Faire
description:
A Medieval Adventure 
A day of wondrous whimsy awaits you! Pass through the gates of Avalon and be transported to the time of King Arthur, Lady Guinevere and the Knights of the Round Table! Escape from the bustle of modern life and spend a day (or a weekend) in our magical realm amidst marvels and merriment and music that make your spirit soar.  Be dazzled by our knights in shining armor jousting astride their magnificent steeds, browse handcrafted wares of merchants and artisans, sample delectable food and drink, and enjoy fun and games for the whole family. Join us and have the time of your life!

name: Cavern City Renaissance Festival
description: Step into a world of enchantment and revelry at the Cavern City Renaissance Festival, where history comes alive through captivating music & magic, 70+ artisan vendors, thrilling armored combat, and bountiful food & drink!

name: Colorado Renaissance Festival
description: As you wander down the village streets and pathways of the Colorado Renaissance Festival, experience a 16th Century Medieval Amusement Park! Ready yourself to revel with master revelers, watch artisans create original works of their ancient craft, and be taken in by the tantalizing aromas of roast turkey legs, steak on a stake, fresh baked goods, and much more.

name: Enchanted Village Renaissance Faire
description: Experience the best music, food, and fun at Enchanted Village Renaissance Faire

name: Faire of Champions
description:
Nestled in the hills outside of Palestine, Texas, a new realm has been founded.

In the year 2020, what started as an ember of ideas has now burst into the flame of reality. Faire of Champions embraces all adventurers looking to write their own epic story. The realm welcomes all magical beings, from Fairies and Trolls to Space Rangers, Robots and Cowboys. Pirates and Vikings make their appearance every season for an immersive experience not soon forgotten.

name: Idaho Renaissance Faire
description: The Idaho Renaissance Faire is a fun group of folk who enjoy teaching and learning about History in a fun and engaging environment. Our fundraising events not only benefit the organization and those we are donating to, but also the local artists, craftsman, small businesses, and performers who make them such wonderful affairs.  As a 501(c)3 organization a portion of our proceeds go to local schools with the designated purpose of furthering the finer arts.  See our donation page for more information!

name: King Richard’s Faire
description: King Richard’s Faire is the largest, biggest, and best Renaissance festival in the six states of New England. Visit us to escape your reality and be prepared to make memories that will last a lifetime in our world of magic and merriment!

name: Koroneburg Renaissance Festival
description: The Koroneburg Renaissance Festival is one of the only permanently built Renaissance faires in Southern California, and is the most interactive Renaissance experience around! We offer great audience-participation content, giving you plenty to do and opportunities to learn about ye ol’ German 1450-1600 A.D. history!

name: Louisiana Renaissance Festival
description: The Louisiana Renaissance Festival is a lively and immersive event that aims to recreate the atmosphere, culture, and entertainment of the Renaissance period, which typically spanned from the 14th to the 17th century in Europe.

name: Maryland Renaissance Festival
description: Unique among most festivals, including renaissance festivals, the Maryland Renaissance Festival utilizes a storyline and progresses each year forward in the timeline of Henry VIII, through all his reign and all six of his wives.  This season the year is 1539 and the royal story is played out in stage shows and in improvisations throughout the festival grounds.

name: New Braunfels Renaissance Faire
description:
Time travel to the greatest party since Camelot!
Take a stroll through the 10 acre Heritage Village
where history comes alive with non-stop, day-long, immersive and interactive entertainments
like no place else! Shop for an abundance of arts
and crafts in the village open-air Marktplatz!

name: Northern California Renaissance Faire
description: Our village of Willingtown comes to life as our annual faire welcomes Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth and the most famous Privateer of the time, Sir Walter Raleigh. Happy peasants, crooked Constables, gossiping washerwomen, and merry maidens fill the streets with revelry as the festivities begin. Talented and exotic performers from throughout the globe fill the streets and stages with traditional music, dance and comedy.

name: Ohio Renaissance Festival
description:
Forget your cares and step back in time to this 30-acre re-created 16th Century English village and enjoy over 400 years of fun in a single day!

Visitors will see a full day of entertainment including full-armored Jousting the way it was done over 400 years ago by real Knights in shining armor. Queen Elizabeth I presides over the festivities as dozens of Renaissance musicians, dancers, comedians, jugglers, sword-fighters, storytellers and hundreds of costumed performers entertain patrons of all ages on 17 stages in over 100 shows daily.

name: Renaissance Pleasure Faire
description: Begun in 1963 in Agoura, near Malibu, to create “living history” for school children and their families, the Original Renaissance Pleasure Faire has grown into an annual interactive playground and gallery for over 200,000 participants and guests. It has given birth to an industry nationwide and this year is more fun and exciting than ever.

name: Scarborough Renaissance Festival
description: Since 1981, Scarborough Renaissance Festival has been a North Texas tradition providing interactive fun for everyone, 16th Century style. Scarborough is a Renaissance themed festival set in a re-created 16th Century English village celebrating the visit of King Henry VIII, his Royal Court and other dignitaries.

name: Sherwood Forest Faire
description: Sherwood Forest Faire is a locally owned medieval-style village nestled in the Lost Pines section of Central Texas. We have over 100 permanent buildings on 25 acres, including stages, pubs, merchant shoppes, wedding venues, a complete castle, and more.

name: Sterling Renaissance Festival
description: Tucked within a luscious forest, surrounded by a sea of rolling green, hides the village of Warwick, England. You’ll find that people are spirited and the grounds are especially well-kept—particularly on the eve of the Queen’s arrival.  Come and explore this majestic, boisterous celebration set upon more than 35 acres of untouched land.

name: St. Petersburg Renaissance Faire
description: The St. Petersburg Renaissance Faire boasts over 100 costumed performances across 9 Stages, more than 50 Artisans and 3 Pubs. Live Music, Sword Fighting, Jugglers, Shopping, and Drinking abound in the 10-Acre Shire of Heyford. The Renaissance Faire Returns to Pinellas County after over 20 years.

name: Texas Renaissance Festival
description: Huzzah and welcome to the Texas Renaissance Festival, a grand spectacle that transports visitors to an era of chivalry, merriment, and enchantment. Nestled in the heart of Texas, we are the largest and most acclaimed Renaissance-themed attraction in the United States.

name: Three Barons Renaissance Fair
description:
Our wondrous fair is held in commemoration of Hillthelstan the Bold, our communities namesake. This great festival is put forth annually over two weekends.

Each year we are honored by the Barons: Red, Green and Blue, as they compete for the privilege of winning the relic associated with our shire, the Spear of Hillthelstan the Bold.

name: Two Rivers Renaissance Faire
description: Envisioned and created by a local family, the faire comes each year to Yuma in the hopes of bringing something unique and exciting to our city. For less than the cost of a trip to the movies, you can step into another time and stay for the day.

name: Virginia Renaissance Faire
description: Music, stage performances, jousting, hound coursing, living history demonstrations, and more! Explore the many things to do and see around our fair village of Staffordshire.
